examples: She denies possessing the drug with intent to supply.
He was charged with wounding with intent.
His intent is clearly not to placate his critics.

meanings.def: in the effects that something has, if not in reality; almost completely
examples: By 1981 the docks had, to all intents and purposes, closed.
The two items are, for all intents and purposes, identical.

idioms.def: in the effects that something has, if not in reality; almost completely
examples: By 1981 the docks had, to all intents and purposes, closed.
The two items are, for all intents and purposes, identical.
His face filled with an intent curiosity.

meanings.def: determined to do something, especially something that will harm other people
examples: intent on/upon something They were intent on murder.
intent on/upon doing something Are you intent upon destroying my reputation?
They are clearly intent on maintaining standards.

meanings.def: giving all your attention to something
examples: I was so intent on my work that I didn't notice the time.
The bright brown eyes were intent on Marie.
She was very intent on her work.
